website_summaries.verdict: Designed to quickly turn external hard drives into a home storage network, the MediaShare Mini could use lots of improvement in regard to ease of use. Savvy users, however, will find it a fun device to have.
pros: The Verbatim MediaShare Mini is compact and affordable
It supports four external hard drives
cons: The MediaShare Mini is a hassle to set up and confusing to use
The device's throughput is comparatively slow, it doesn't support 3TB external hard drives, and it offers a limited number of user accounts out of the box

customer_reviews.title: Didn't need to set up yet another machine
customer_reviews.text: Neat concept that allows for remote access as well as advanced torrent sharing. Won't use it for anything more than a NAS to share out an array of drives. One of the pleasant surprises is windows 7 sees this as a media server or another computer so using this allows easy access thru windows media player. We have too many media files to justify hosting everything from a desktop so this allows me to take all that data from our desktops to further isolate them from catastrophic failure. This has five USB 2.0 ports so it's flexible enough to grow into as well.
customer_reviews.author: jeff beary

customer_reviews.title: Verbatims offshore customer service was horrible. They just couldn't understand what I was asking ...
customer_reviews.text: In the description there was no mention of a limitation on external drives to only 2TB, Verbatims offshore customer service was horrible. They just couldn't understand what I was asking nor was I able to understand their hindenglish responses. I have (2) 5TB External HDs I wanted to network without using a computer running 24/7/365. This is obviously not a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amppcguru

customer_reviews.title: Affordable NAS
customer_reviews.text: This very affordable little box works perfectly as a home NAS (Network Accessible Storage) device. I have had it running for several months now, primarily as my backup server, with 3.75TB of storage. It is always accessible and delivers quite acceptable performance for backups and storing photos, etc. The unit requires an Ethernet hardwire connection (i.e. one of the ports on your wireless router) and supports up to 4 external USB hard-drives. I have 3 drives currently installed (2TB, 1TB and a 750GB drive), each one was just a simple plug-and-play installation, with no formatting or configuration required. Love this box - great value.
customer_reviews.author: C. Edward Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Read other reviews and decided to purchase and take for a spin. Got product, installed software on 2 laptops running Windows XP and 2 with Windows 7 (64bit). Have had it for a few weeks and all is well. I've been to a friend's house and accessed my files remotely with ease. Decided to download HipServ to access files from my Android phone. Works well and have had no problems. I wasn't interested in the other model with a built in 1tb drive because I already had a couple of 1tb+ drives. I was more interested in the ability to have 4 usb ports to connect to. Overall, I'd recommend it! Great product!

It's hard to play the media to the shared computers unless you download the files. Other than that, it works pretty much perfectly. Easy to download the files, and easy to upload the files. Just really good stuff.

customer_reviews.title: Does many things, but nothing well
customer_reviews.text: I read most of the other reviews here, and I see everything has already been said about this device, so I'll get to the point: it's not worth the money or the time. There are so many other free options available, each of which does its job better that this all-in-one piece of hardware. It's not *bad*, it's just not good enough...
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the set up
customer_reviews.text: I have several external devices to my computer, but I never need to use them all at the same time. I have enough USB ports on my computer to use more two at a time, which is all I really need. I thought this would be a cool device, but it just isn't for me. I use mostly a laptop, and having this attached, plus my other drives attached.... is just too cumbersome. Not for me, but nothing wrong with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Krykie

product_meta.title: Verbatim MediaShare Mini Home Network Storage, Silver 97329
product_meta.description:
Verbatim MediaShare Mini Home Network Storage 97329 (Silver). Media Sharing Station

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




Connect
Connect up to 4 USB storage drives and immediately access all of the files on your network. Manage, view or play content on any computer on your home network or outside the home using any computer with internet access.




Share
Unlimited File Sharing: Share your files with friends, family, co-workers using file albums.

Social Network Sharing: Upload your photos directly to Facebook and other Social Media sites.

Photo Albums: Create and share access to photo albums using email links sent automatically by MediaShare.





Access & Manage Anywhere
Computer Access: Upload and download files from any location inside or outside the home.

Anytime Mobile Access:Access your files through an iPhone, iPad or other mobile devices. View Microsoft Office files, read PDF documents, enjoy photos or play music remotely all with ease. Premium subscription not required.






Stream
Digital Media Players: Stream your files to any DLNA / uPnP device such as PS3, Xbox360 or other similar digital media players.

iTunes™ & Sonos™ :Enjoy playing your music directly to iTunes clients or Sonos™ wireless audio systems from any USB drive connected to MediaShare Mini.

Media Player: Use the included media player capabilities of MediaShare to view photos or play music and videos on your computer whether you are at home or in a café.

Upload your photos directly to Facebook, Flickr* and more (*premium subscription required)
